title: PokéFort Commands
description:
**Page 1 | Getting Started!**
How to get started on the bot and dex commands. `/help 1`

**Page 2 | Basic Commands!**
The main commands for the bot and pokémon commands. `/help 2`

**Page 3 | Trading!**
How to trade pokémon, redeems and credits on the bot. `/help 3`

**Page 4 | Market!**
How to buy and sell pokémon using the market. `/help 4`

**Page 5 | Search Options!**
Search options for market searching. `/help 5`

**Page 6 | Shop and Others!**
Shop commands and some misc commands. `/help 6`

**Page 7 | Duelling!**
How to duel with your pokémon. `/help 7`

**Page 8 | Raid!**
Create your own powerful teams and beat the raid boss along with your friends. `/help 8`

**Page 9 | Auction!**
How to join the global auction, buy and sell special pokémons. `/help 9`

**Page 10 | Bot commands!**
Bot commands and server commands. `/help 10`
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Getting Started!
description:
How to get started on the bot and dex commands.

**/start** | This enters you into the game. You have to use this command first before you can catch any Pokémon.

**/pick** | Once you've done the start command. You can pick from any of the starters across all of the generations.

**/catch** <Pokémon Name> | When a wild Pokémon spawns, you will use this command and the correct name to catch it.

**/hint** | Will display a hint to the currently spawned Pokémon.

**/select** <Pokémon Number> | Selects which Pokémon will receive XP from chatting and which will battle.

**/select latest** | Selects your most recently caught or redeemed Pokémon.

**/nickname** <nickname> | Gives a nickname to your selected Pokémon.

**/info** | Displays the information of your SELECTED Pokémon.

**/info latest** | Displays the information of the LATEST Pokémon you've caught.

**/info** <Pokémon Number> | Displays the information of the Pokémon attached to this number.

**/dex** <Pokémon Name> | Display a Pokémon with its base stats.

**/dex shiny** <Pokémon Name> | Displays a shiny version of a Pokémon with its base stats.

**/dex** | Displays your Pokedex.

**/dex --caught** | Displays the caught Pokémon.

**/dex --uncaught** | Displays the uncaught Pokémon.

**/dex --rewards** | Displays all your dex rewards.

**/dex claim** <Reward Name> | Collects the specified reward.

**/dex claim all** | Collects all your dex rewards.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Basic Commands
description:
The main commands for the bot and pokémon commands.
**/daily** | Allows you to vote for the Pokéfort server on the Discord Bots site. You get 100 - 1000 credit for doing this every 12 hours.

**/silence** | Toggles your level up messages.

**/dm** | Toggles your duel instruction messages.

**/redeem** <Pokémon Name> | If you have a redeem available, you will receive a Pokémon of the name you entered.

**/redeem credits** | Sells a redeem you own for 15,000 credits back to the bot itself.

**/redeemspawn** <Pokémon Name> | Spawns the given pokémon in the channel using your redeem.

**/pokémon** | Displays a list of your Pokémon. It also displays information, such as Level, Number, IVs, and Nickname.

**/pokémon --name** <Pokémon Name> | Displays a list of Pokémon you own of that particular name.

**/pokémon --shiny** | Displays your shiny Pokémon.

**/pokémon --legendary** | Displays your legendary Pokémon.

**/pokémon --mythical** | Displays your mythical Pokémon.

**/pokémon --ultrabeast** | Displays your ultra beast Pokémon.

**/pokémon --alolan** | Displays your alolan Pokémon.

**/pokémon --galarian** | Displays your galarian Pokémon.

**/pokémon --hisuian** | Displays your hisuian pokémon.

**/pokémon --nickname** <Nickname> | Displays your specific Pokémon with that nickname.

**/pokémon --level** <Value> | Displays your Pokémon with that level.

**/pokémon --level** < / > <Value> | Displays your Pokémon In-between that filter.

**/pokémon --iv <Value> or --iv < / > <Value>** | Displays your Pokémon with or In-between that filter.

**/pokémon --hpiv/attackiv/defenceiv/specialattackiv/specialdefenceiv/speediv <Value> or --hpiv/attackiv/defenceiv/specialattackiv/specialdefenceiv/speediv < / > <Value>** | Displays your Pokémon with or In-between that filter.

**/pokémon --type** <Type name> | Displays your Pokémon of that type.

**/pokémon --triple/quadra/penta** <Value> | Displays your Pokémon with triple/quadra/penta max iv (31) or min iv (0). Value = 31/0
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Trading!
description:
How to trade Pokémon, redeems and credits on the bot.

**/trade @User** | Begins a trade with someone. They will then have to do /accept to do the trade or /deny to reject it.

**/p add** <Pokémon numbers, seperated by spaces> | Add one or multiple Pokémon to your trade offer.

**/p remove** <Pokémon numbers, seperated by spaces> | Remove one or multiple Pokémon from your trade offer.

**/c add** <Amount> | Add credits to your trade offer.

**/c remove** <Amount> | Remove credits from your trade offer.

**/r add** <Amount> | Add a redeem to your trade offer.

**/r remove** <Amount> | Remove a redeem from your trade offer.

**/confirm** | Confirm the trade, both users must confirm for the trade to go through.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Market!
description:
How to buy and sell pokémon using the market.

**/market search** <Page number> | Show the requested page of the market.

**/market search** <Page number> <Search Options> <Order Option> | Search the market.

**/market view** <Pokémon ID> | View detailed information for a Pokémon on the market.

**/market info** <Pokémon ID> | Alternative to view.

**/market list** <Pokémon Number> <Price> | List a pokémon on the market.

**/market buy** <Pokémon ID> | Buy a Pokémon from the market. You will need to confirm your purchase with /confirmbuy or cancel it with /cancel.

`
**/market remove** <Pokémon ID> | Remove one of your Pokémon from the market.

**/market listings** <Page number> | Display the Pokémon you have listed on the market.

**Order Options**

--order id ascending/descending | Order results by Pokémon ID.

--order lvl ascending/descending | Order results by Pokémon level.

--order price ascending/descending | Order results by price.

--order iv ascending/descending | Order by the sum of the Pokémon's IVs.

--order name ascending/descending | Order results by name.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Search Options!
description:
Search options for market searching.

**--name** <name> | Search for Pokémon by name

**--level** <level> or < / > <level> | Search for Pokémon by level.

**--holding** <holding> | Search for Pokémon by the item they are holding.

**--type** <type> | Search for Pokémon by type.

**--price** <price> or < / > <price>  | Search for Pokémon with a specific price.

**--hpiv** <IV> or < / > <IVl> | Search for Pokémon by their HP IV.

**--atkiv** <IV> or < / > <IV> | Search for Pokémon by their Attack IV.

**--defiv** <IV> or < / > <IV> | Search for Pokémon by their Defense IV.

**--spatkiv** <IV> or < / > <IV> | Search for Pokémon by their Special Attack IV.

**--spdefiv** <IV>or < / > <IV> | Search for Pokémon by their Special Defense IV.

**--speediv** <IV> or < / > <IV> | Search for Pokémon by their Speed IV.

**--shiny** | Search for shiny Pokémon.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Shop and Others!
description:
Shop commands and some misc commands.

**/shop** | Opens the shop menu. You can purchase XP Boosters, Rare Candies, Rare Stones, Evolution Items, Nature Modifiers, Held Items, and Mega Evolutions!.

**/buy** <Item ID> | Purchases an item from the shop.

**/dropitem** | Drops the item which your current Pokémon is holding.

**/mega** | Command to evolve Pokémon to a Mega X or Y. You must have a Mega Evolution purchased, they cost 1,000 credits each.

**/release** <Pokémon Number> | This will release a Pokémon. .release will attempt to release your selected Pokémon, confirmation prompt will be displayed beforehand.

**/recycle** <Pokémon Number> | This will recycle the number of Pokémon. By recycling, the selected pokémon level ups.

**/fav** | This will show a list of your favorite Pokémon!

**/addfav** <Pokémon Number> | Adds a Pokémon to your favorites list.

**/removefav** <Pokémon Number> | Removes a Pokémon from your favorites list.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Duelling!
description:
How to duel with your pokémon.

**/select** <Pokémon Number> | This will be the Pokémon you use in battle.

**/moves** | Displays your selected Pokémon's current moves, and the available moves it can learn.

**/learn** <Move> | Attempts to learn the move you've chosen. You will need to choose which move you want to replace.

**/replace** <Number> | Replaces a current move with the one you are trying to learn.

**/duel** <@Username> | Challenges the select Discord user to a Duel. Be sure to @ them and not just type in their name.

**/accept** | Accepts a duel if you've been challenged.

**/use** <Move Number> | Your selected Pokémon will use the move that is listed by that number.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Raid!
description:
Create your own powerful teams and beat the raid boss along with your friends.

**/raid spawn**| Spawns a raid. A normal raid can be spawned every 3 hours, while event raids (which can only be done on weekends) cost 1 wishing piece. You can use /r spawn as an abbreviation.

**/raid join** <id> | Allows you to join a raid. /r join <id> can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid leave** | Allows you to leave a raid. /r leave can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid start** | Allows you to start the raid. This command can only be used by the leader of the raid!. /r start can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid info** | Allows you to view the raid you are currently in. /r info can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid duel** | Allows you to duel the raid boss. Once in a duel, you can use /team to view your current team, /use <move number> to use a move and /switch <number> to switch pokémon.

**/raid kick** | Allows you to kick a member in the raid you are currently in. This command can only be used by the leader of the raid. /r kick <number> can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid ban** |  Allows you to ban a member in the raid you are currently in. This command can only be used by the leader of the raid. /r ban <number> can be used as an abbreviation. This permanently kicks the user from the raid. The user cannot be unbanned.

**/raid profile** | Allows you to view all the difficulties of raid bosses you have defeated. /r profile can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid dex** | Allows you to view all the raid bosses you have defeated. /r dex can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid eventdex** | Allows you to view all the gigantamax raid bosses you have defeated. /r eventdex can be used as an abbreviation.

**/raid cancel** | Allows you to cancel your raid battle in between. /r cancel can be used as an abbreviation.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Auction!
description:
How to join the global auction, buy and sell special pokémons.

**/auction search** | Search Pokémons that are being auctioned. /auc search or /auc s can also be used.

**/auction view** <ID> | View detailed information of a pokémon on the auction house. /auc view <ID>, /auc info <ID> , /auc i <ID> are alternatives for this command.

**/auction list** <Pokémon Number> <buyout> <time> | List a pokémon on the auction house. (Time format: XhYmZs).

**/auction bid** <ID> <credits> | Bid on a pokémon from the auction house. /auc bid <ID> <credits> can be used as an abbreviation.

**/auction listings** | Display the pokémons you have listed on the auction house. /auc listings can be used as an abbreviation.

**/auction claim** <ID> | Claim a completed auction. Can be used by auctioneer or auction winner after the auction has ended. /auc claim can be used as an abbreviation.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Bot commands!
description:
Bot commands and server commands.

**/botinfo** | Shows general bot information.

**/invite** | Gives the bot's invite link.

**/donate** | Sends a link to donate to support the bot.

**/server** | Sends an invite to the bot's official server.

**/appeal** | (Official Server Only) Attempts to give you unbanned from the official server if you were banned for a reason.

**Server Commands**

**/setprefix** <prefix> | Sets server prefix.

**/redirect** <#Channel Name> | If you want Pokémon to spawn in a certain channel you can use this command to change it.

**/redirect disable** | If you want to enable spawns in all channels again, you can use this command.

**/channel enable/disable** | Enables or disables /commands in the channel you are currently in.

**/levelup enable/disable** | Enables or disables level up alerts.

**/clearspawns enable/disable** | Enables or disables the deletion of spawn message once a Pokémon is caught.
footer: Need more help? Join the official server by using the /server command!

title: Creating Team

Note: You can only create 30 teams

Syntax: `/teamcreate` --name _<team-name>_ --id _<pokémon-id>_

Example: `/teamcreate` --name myteam --id 1 2 3

title: Displays TMS
description:
This command is used to display TM moves selected pokémon or given pokémon.

Syntax: `/tms [_<pokémon-name>_]`

Example#1: `/tms bulbasaur  --> Shows TMS of Bulbsaur
Example#2: `/tms` --> Shows TMS of selected pokémon.

Example#2: `/weak tackle` --> Shows information of tackle.
